hadith-eng:
I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) saying, "We (Muslims) are the last (to come) but (will be) the 
foremost on the Day of Resurrection though the former nations were given the Holy Scriptures before 
us. And this was their day (Friday) the celebration of which was made compulsory for them but they 
differed about it. So Allah gave us the guidance for it (Friday) and all the other people are behind us in 
this respect: the Jews' (holy day is) tomorrow (i.e. Saturday) and the Christians' (is) the day after 
tomorrow (i.e. Sunday)."
question: What significance does Friday hold for Muslims compared to other religious communities?

hadith-eng: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) said, "Anyone of you attending the Friday (prayers) should take a bath."
question: What is the significance of taking a bath before attending Friday prayers in Islam?

hadith-eng:
While `Umar bin Al-Khattab was standing and delivering the sermon on a Friday, one of the 
companions of the Prophet, who was one of the foremost Muhajirs (emigrants) came. `Umar said to 
him, "What is the time now?" He replied, "I was busy and could not go back to my house till I heard 
the Adhan. I did not perform more than the ablution." Thereupon `Umar said to him, "Did you 
perform only the ablution although you know that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) used to order us to take a 
bath (on Fridays)?"
question: What is the significance of performing a bath on Fridays in Islam?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) said, "The taking of a bath on Friday is compulsory for every male (Muslim) 
who has attained the age of puberty."
question: What is the significance of taking a bath on Friday for Muslim males who have reached puberty?

hadith-eng:
I testify that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "The taking of a bath on Friday is compulsory for every male 
Muslim who has attained the age of puberty and (also) the cleaning of his teeth with Siwak, and the 
using of perfume if it is available." `Amr (a sub-narrator) said, "I confirm that the taking of a bath is 
compulsory, but as for the Siwak and the using of perfume, Allah knows better whether it is 
obligatory or not, but according to the Hadith it is as above.")
question: What are the recommended practices for a male Muslim on Fridays according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) said, "Any person who takes a bath on Friday like the bath of Janaba and 
then goes for the prayer (in the first hour i.e. early), it is as if he had sacrificed a camel (in Allah's 
cause); and whoever goes in the second hour it is as if he had sacrificed a cow; and whoever goes in 
the third hour, then it is as if he had sacrificed a horned ram; and if one goes in the fourth hour, then it 
is as if he had sacrificed a hen; and whoever goes in the fifth hour then it is as if he had offered an 
egg. When the Imam comes out (i.e. starts delivering the Khutba), the angels present themselves to 
listen to the Khutba."
question: What is the significance of taking a bath on Friday before attending the prayer?

hadith-eng:
While `Umar (bin Al-Khattab) was delivering the Khutba on a Friday, a man entered (the mosque). 
`Umar asked him, "What has detained you from the prayer?" The man said, "It was only that when I 
heard the Adhan I performed ablution (for the prayer)." On that `Umar said, "Did you not hear the 
Prophet saying: 'Anyone of you going out for the Jumua prayer should take a bath'?".
question: What is the significance of taking a bath before attending the Jumua prayer?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (p.b.u.h) said, "Whoever takes a bath on Friday, purifies himself as much as he can, then 
uses his (hair) oil or perfumes himself with the scent of his house, then proceeds (for the Jumua 
prayer) and does not separate two persons sitting together (in the mosque), then prays as much as 
(Allah has) written for him and then remains silent while the Imam is delivering the Khutba, his sins 
in-between the present and the last Friday would be forgiven."
question: What are the recommended actions to perform before attending the Friday prayer?

hadith-eng:
I said to Ibn `Abbas, "The people are narrating that the Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Take a bath on Friday and wash 
your heads (i.e. take a thorough bath) even though you were not Junub and use perfume'." On that Ibn 
`Abbas replied, "I know about the bath, (i.e. it is essential) but I do not know about the perfume (i.e. 
whether it is essential or not.)
question: What is the significance of taking a bath on Friday in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng:
Ibn `Abbas mentioned the statement of the Prophet (ﷺ) regarding the taking of a bath on Friday and then I 
asked him whether the Prophet (p.b.u.h) had ordered perfume or (hair) oil to be used if they could be 
found in one's house. He (Ibn `Abbas) replied that he did not know about it.
question: What is the significance of taking a bath on Friday in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng:
`Umar bin Al-Khattab saw a silken cloak (being sold) at the gate of the Mosque and said to Allah's 
Apostle, "I wish you would buy this to wear on Fridays and also on occasions of the arrivals of the 
delegations." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) replied, "This will be worn by a person who will have no share (reward) 
in the Hereafter." Later on similar cloaks were given to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and he gave one of them to 
`Umar bin Al-Khattab. On that `Umar said, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! You have given me this cloak 
although on the cloak of Atarid (a cloak merchant who was selling that silken cloak at the gate of the 
mosque) you passed such and such a remark." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) replied, "I have not given you this to 
wear". And so `Umar bin Al-Khattab gave it to his pagan brother in Mecca to wear.
question: What is the significance of avoiding certain types of clothing in Islam according to the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "If I had not found it hard for my followers or the people, I would have ordered 
them to clean their teeth with Siwak for every prayer."
question: What is the significance of using Siwak in Islamic practice?

hadith-eng: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "I have told you repeatedly to use the Siwak. (The Prophet (ﷺ) put emphasis on the use of the Siwak.)
question: What is the significance of using the Siwak in Islamic practice?

hadith-eng: When the Prophet (p.b.u.h) got up at night (for the night prayer), he used to clean his mouth .
question: What practice did the Prophet Muhammad (p.b.u.h) follow before performing the night prayer?

hadith-eng:
`Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Bakr came holding a Siwak with which he was cleaning his teeth. Allah's 
Apostle looked at him. I requested `Abdur-Rahman to give the Siwak to me and after he gave it to me 
I divided it, chewed it and gave it to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). Then he cleaned his teeth with it and (at that 
time) he was resting against my chest.
question: What is the significance of using a Siwak in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) used to recite the following in the Fajr prayer of Friday, "Alif, Lam, Mim, Tanzil" (Suratas- 
Sajda #32) and "Hal-ata-ala-l-Insani" (i.e. Surah-Ad-Dahr #76).
question: Which Surahs did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) recite during the Fajr prayer on Fridays?

hadith-eng:
The first Jumua prayer which was offered after a Jumua prayer offered at the mosque of Allah's 
Apostle took place in the mosque of the tribe of `Abdul Qais at Jawathi in Bahrain.
question: Where was the first Jumua prayer after the Prophet's mosque offered?

hadith-eng:
I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saying, "All of you are Guardians." Yunis said: Ruzaiq bin Hukaim wrote to 
Ibn Shihab while I was with him at Wadi-al-Qura saying, "Shall I lead the Jumua prayer?" Ruzaiq was 
working on the land (i.e. farming) and there was a group of Sudanese people and some others with 
him; Ruzaiq was then the Governor of Aila. Ibn Shihab wrote (to Ruzaiq) ordering him to lead the 
Jumua prayer and telling him that Salim told him that `Abdullah bin `Umar had said, "I heard Allah's 
Apostle saying, 'All of you are guardians and responsible for your wards and the things under your 
care. The Imam (i.e. ruler) is the guardian of his subjects and is responsible for them and a man is the 
guardian of his family and is responsible for them. A woman is the guardian of her husband's house 
and is responsible for it. A servant is the guardian of his master's belongings and is responsible for 
them.' I thought that he also said, 'A man is the guardian of his father's property and is responsible for 
it. All of you are guardians and responsible for your wards and the things under your care."
question: What are the responsibilities of different individuals in society according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saying, "Anyone of you coming for the Jumua prayer should take a bath."
question: What is the significance of taking a bath before attending the Jumua prayer?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "The taking of a bath on Friday is compulsory for every Muslim who has 
attained the age of puberty."
question: What is the significance of taking a bath on Friday for Muslims who have reached puberty?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said "We are the last (to come amongst the nations) 
     but (will be) the foremost on the Day of Resurrection. They were given
     the Holy Scripture before us and we were given the Quran after them. 
     And this was the day (Friday) about which they differed and Allah gave
     us the guidance (for that). So tomorrow (i.e. Saturday) is the Jews' 
     (day), and the day after tomorrow (i.e. Sunday) is the Christians'." 
     The Prophet (p.b.u.h) remained silent (for a while) and then said, "It
     is obligatory for every Muslim that he should take a bath once in 
     seven days, when he should wash his head and body."
question: What significance does Friday hold in Islam compared to the holy days of other religions?

hadith-eng:
Narrated Abu Huraira through different narrators that the Prophet (ﷺ) 
     said, "It is Allah's right on every Muslim that he should take a bath 
     (at least) once in seven days."
question: What is the significance of personal hygiene in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (p.b.u.h) said, "Allow women to go to the Mosques at night."
question: What is the significance of allowing women to attend mosques during the night in Islam?

hadith-eng:
One of the wives of `Umar (bin Al-Khattab) used to offer the Fajr and the `Isha' prayer in 
congregation in the Mosque. She was asked why she had come out for the prayer as she knew that 
`Umar disliked it, and he has great ghaira (self-respect). She replied, "What prevents him from 
stopping me from this act?" The other replied, "The statement of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) : 'Do not 
stop Allah's women-slaves from going to Allah's Mosques' prevents him."
question: What is the significance of allowing women to attend prayers in the mosque according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
On a rainy day Ibn `Abbas said to his Mu'adh-dhin, "After saying, 'Ash-hadu anna Muhammadan 
Rasulullah' (I testify that Muhammad is Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)), do not say 'Haiya 'Alas-Salat' (come for the 
prayer) but say 'Pray in your houses'." (The man did so). But the people disliked it. Ibn `Abbas said, 
"It was done by one who was much better than I (i.e. the Prophet (p.b.u.h) ). No doubt, the Jumua 
prayer is compulsory but I dislike to put you to task by bringing you out walking in mud and slush."
question: What considerations should be taken into account when calling people to prayer during adverse weather conditions?

hadith-eng:
(the wife of the Prophet) The people used to come from their abodes and from Al-`Awali (i.e. 
outskirts of Medina up to a distance of four miles or more from Medina). They used to pass through 
dust and used to be drenched with sweat and covered with dust; so sweat used to trickle from them. 
One of them came to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) who was in my house. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to him, "I wish that you 
keep yourself clean on this day of yours (i.e. take a bath)."
question: What is the significance of cleanliness in Islam, especially on specific days?

hadith-eng:
I asked `Amra about taking a bath on Fridays. She replied, " Aisha said, 'The people used to work (for 
their livelihood) and whenever they went for the Jumua prayer, they used to go to the mosque in the 
same shape as they had been in work. So they were asked to take a bath on Friday.' "
question: What is the significance of taking a bath on Fridays before attending the Jumua prayer?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to offer the Jumua prayer immediately after midday.
question: When did the Prophet (ﷺ) typically perform the Jumu'ah prayer?

hadith-eng: We used to offer the Jumua prayer early and then have an afternoon nap.
question: What is the significance of offering the Jumua prayer early in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) used to offer the prayer earlier if it was very cold; and if it was very hot he used to delay 
the prayer, i.e. the Jumua prayer.
question: How did the Prophet (ﷺ) adjust the timing of prayers based on weather conditions?

hadith-eng:
I heard the Prophet (ﷺ) saying, "Anyone whose feet are covered with dust in Allah's cause, shall be saved 
by Allah from the Hell-Fire."
question: What is the significance of striving in the cause of Allah according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)s (p.b.u.h) saying, "If the prayer is started do not run for it but just walk for it 
calmly and pray whatever you get, and complete whatever is missed. "
question: What is the recommended behavior when one is late for a congregational prayer?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (p.b.u.h) said, "Do not stand up (for prayer) unless you see me, and observe calmness and 
solemnity".
question: What is the significance of observing calmness and solemnity in prayer?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) said, "Anyone who takes a bath on Friday and cleans himself as much as he 
can and puts oil (on his hair) or scents himself; and then proceeds for the prayer and does not force his 
way between two persons (assembled in the mosque for the Friday prayer), and prays as much as is 
written for him and remains quiet when the Imam delivers the Khutba, all his sins in between the 
present and the last Friday will be forgiven."
question: What are the recommended actions for a Muslim to perform on Friday before attending the congregational prayer?

hadith-eng:
I heard Nazi' saying, "Ibn `Umar, said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade that a man should make another man to 
get up to sit in his place' ". I said to Nafi`, 'Is it for Jumua prayer only?' He replied, "For Jumua prayer 
and any other (prayer)."
question: What is the significance of respecting others' seating arrangements in Islamic gatherings?

hadith-eng:
In the lifetime of the Prophet, Abu Bakr and `Umar, the Adhan for the Jumua prayer used to be 
pronounced when the Imam sat on the pulpit. But during the Caliphate of `Uthman when the Muslims 
increased in number, a third Adhan at Az-Zaura' was added. Abu `Abdullah said, "Az-Zaura' is a place 
in the market of Medina."
question: How did the practice of Adhan for Jumu'a prayer evolve during the time of the Prophet and the Caliphs?

hadith-eng:
The person who increased the number of Adhans for the Jumua prayers to three was `Uthman bin 
`Affan and it was when the number of the (Muslim) people of Medina had increased. In the lifetime of 
the Prophet (ﷺ) there was only one Mu'adh-dhin and the Adhan used to be pronounced only after the 
Imam had taken his seat (i.e. on the pulpit).
question: Who was responsible for increasing the number of Adhans for the Jumua prayers to three?

hadith-eng:
I heard Muawiya bin Abi Sufyan (repeating the statements of the Adhan) while he was sitting on the 
pulpit. When the Mu'adh-dhin pronounced the Adhan saying, "Allahu-Akbar, Allahu Akbar", 
Muawiya said: "Allah Akbar, Allahu Akbar." And when the Mu'adh-dhin said, "Ash-hadu an la ilaha 
illal-lah (I testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah)", Muawiya said, "And (so do) I". 
When he said, "Ash-hadu anna Muhammadan Rasulullah" (I testify that Muhammad is Allah's 
Apostle), Muawiya said, "And (so do) I". When the Adhan was finished, Muawiya said, "O people, 
when the Mu'adh-dhin pronounced the Adhan I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) on this very pulpit saying what 
you have just heard me saying".
question: What is the significance of repeating the statements of the Adhan as demonstrated by Muawiya bin Abi Sufyan?

hadith-eng:
`Uthman bin `Affan introduced the second Adhan on Fridays when the number of the people in the 
mosque increased. Previously the Adhan on Fridays used to be pronounced only after the Imam had 
taken his seat (on the pulpit).
question: What changes did Uthman bin Affan implement regarding the Adhan on Fridays?

hadith-eng:
I heard As-Saib bin Yazid, saying, "In the lifetime of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), and Abu Bakr and `Umar, the 
Adhan for the Jumua prayer used to be pronounced after the Imam had taken his seat on the pulpit. 
But when the people increased in number during the caliphate of `Uthman, he introduced a third 
Adhan (on Friday for the Jumua prayer) and it was pronounced at Az-Zaura' and that new state of 
affairs remained so in the succeeding years.
question: How did the practice of Adhan for Jumua prayer evolve during the caliphate of Uthman?

hadith-eng:
Some people went to Sahl bin Sa`d As-Sa`idi and told him that they had different opinions regarding 
the wood of the pulpit. They asked him about it and he said, "By Allah, I know of what wood the 
pulpit was made, and no doubt I saw it on the very first day when Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) took his seat on it. 
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent for such and such an Ansari woman (and Sahl mentioned her name) and said to 
her, 'Order your slave-carpenter to prepare for me some pieces of wood (i.e. pulpit) on which I may sit 
at the time of addressing the people.' So she ordered her slave-carpenter and he made it from the 
tamarisk of the forest and brought it (to the woman). The woman sent that (pulpit) to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) 
who ordered it to be placed here. Then I saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) praying on it and then bowed on it. Then 
he stepped back, got down and prostrated on the ground near the foot of the pulpit and again ascended 
the pulpit. After finishing the prayer he faced the people and said, 'I have done this so that you may 
follow me and learn the way I pray.' "
question: What was the significance of the pulpit made for the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) and how was it constructed?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) used to stand by a stem of a date-palm tree (while delivering a sermon). When the pulpit 
was placed for him we heard that stem crying like a pregnant she-camel till the Prophet (ﷺ) got down from 
the pulpit and placed his hand over it.
question: What significance does the crying of the date-palm stem hold in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng:
My father said , "I heard the Prophet (ﷺ) delivering the Khutba on the pulpit and he said, 'Whoever comes 
for the Jumua prayer should take a bath (before coming).' "
question: What is the significance of taking a bath before attending the Jumua prayer?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (p.b.u.h) used to deliver the Khutba while standing and then he would sit, then stand 
again as you do now-a-days.
question: What is the traditional method of delivering a Khutba during Friday prayers?

hadith-eng: One day the Prophet (ﷺ) sat on the pulpit and we sat around him.
question: What is the significance of the Prophet sitting on the pulpit in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: Asma' bint Abi Bakr As-Siddiq said, "I went to 'Aishah and the people were offering Salat. I asked her, 'What is wrong with the people ?' She pointed towards the sky with her head. I asked her, 'Is there a sign ?' 'Aishah nodded with her head meaning 'Yes'." Asma' added, "Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) prolonged the Salat to such an extent that I fainted. There was a waterskin by my side and I opened it and poured some water on my head. When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) finished Salat, and the solar eclipse had cleared, the Prophet (ﷺ) addressed the people and praised Allah as He deserves and said, 'Amma ba'du'." Asma' further said, "Some Ansari women started talking, so I turned to them in order to make them quiet. I asked 'Aishah what the Prophet (ﷺ) had said. 'Aishah said: 'He said, 'I have seen things at this place of mine which were never shown to me before; (I have seen) even Paradise and Hell. And, no doubt it has been revealed to me that you (people) will be put in trial in your graves like or nearly like the trial of Masih Ad-Dajjal. (The angels) will come to everyone of you and ask him, 'What do you know about this man (Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)) ?" The faithful believer or firm believer (Hisham was in doubt which word the Prophet (ﷺ) used), will say, 'He is Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and he is Muhammad (ﷺ) who came to us with clear evidences and guidance. So we believed him, accepted his teachings and followed and trusted his teaching.' Then the angels will tell him to sleep (in peace) as they have come to know that he was a believer. But the hypocrite or a doubtful person (Hisham is not sure as to which word the Prophet (ﷺ) used), will be asked what he knew about this man (Prophet Muhammed (ﷺ)). He will say, 'I do not know but I heard the people saying something (about him) so I said the same' " Hisham added, "Fatima told me that she remembered that narration completely by heart except that she said about the hypocrite or a doubtful person that he will be punished severely."
question: What is the significance of the solar eclipse in Islamic tradition and how did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) respond to it?

hadith-eng:
Some property or something was brought to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and he distributed it. He gave to some 
men and ignored the others. Later he got the news of his being admonished by those whom he had 
ignored. So he glorified and praised Allah and said, "Amma ba'du. By Allah, I may give to a man and 
ignore another, although the one whom I ignore is more beloved to me than the one whom I give. But 
I give to some people as I feel that they have no patience and no contentment in their hearts and I 
leave those who are patient and self-content with the goodness and wealth which Allah has put into 
their hearts and `Amr bin Taghlib is one of them." `Amr added, By Allah! Those words of Allah's 
Apostle are more beloved to me than the best red camels.
question: What criteria did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) use when distributing wealth or property among people?

hadith-eng:
Once in the middle of the night Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) went out and prayed in the mosque and some 
men prayed with him. The next morning the people spoke about it and so more people gathered and 
prayed with him (in the second night). They circulated the news in the morning, and so, on the third 
night the number of people increased greatly. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) came out and they prayed 
behind him. On the fourth night the mosque was overwhelmed by the people till it could not 
accommodate them. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) came out only for the Fajr prayer and when he finished the 
prayer, he faced the people and recited "Tashah-hud" (I testify that none has the right to be 
worshipped but Allah and that Muhammad is His Apostle), and then said, "Amma ba'du. Verily your 
presence (in the mosque at night) was not hidden from me, but I was afraid that this prayer (Prayer of 
Tahajjud) might be made compulsory and you might not be able to carry it out."
question: What was the reaction of the people when they saw the Prophet praying at night in the mosque?

hadith-eng:
One night Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) stood up after the prayer and recited "Tashah-hud" and then 
praised Allah as He deserved and said, "Amma ba'du."
question: What is the significance of reciting Tashah-hud after prayer in Islamic practice?

hadith-eng:
Once Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) got up for delivering the Khutba and I heard him after "Tashah-hud" saying 
"Amma ba'du."
question: What is the significance of the phrase 'Amma ba'du' in Islamic sermons?

hadith-eng:
Once the Prophet (ﷺ) ascended the pulpit and it was the last gathering in which he took part. He was 
covering his shoulder with a big cloak and binding his head with an oily bandage. He glorified and 
praised Allah and said, "O people! Come to me." So the people came and gathered around him and he 
then said, "Amma ba'du." "From now onward the Ansar will decrease and other people will increase. 
So anybody who becomes a ruler of the followers of Muhammad and has the power to harm or benefit 
people then he should accept the good from the benevolent amongst them (Ansar) and overlook the 
faults of their wrong-doers."
question: What guidance did the Prophet (ﷺ) give regarding the treatment of the Ansar by future leaders?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to deliver two Khutbas and sit in between them.
question: What is the significance of delivering two Khutbas during a religious sermon?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "When it is a Friday, the angels stand at the gate of the mosque and keep on writing 
the names of the persons coming to the mosque in succession according to their arrivals. The example 
of the one who enters the mosque in the earliest hour is that of one offering a camel (in sacrifice). The 
one coming next is like one offering a cow and then a ram and then a chicken and then an egg 
respectively. When the Imam comes out (for Jumua prayer) they (i.e. angels) fold their papers and 
listen to the Khutba."
question: What is the significance of arriving early to the mosque on Friday according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
A person entered the mosque while the Prophet (ﷺ) was delivering the Khutba on a Friday. The Prophet (ﷺ) 
said to him, "Have you prayed?" The man replied in the negative. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Get up and pray 
two rak`at."
question: What is the significance of performing two rak'ahs upon entering the mosque during the Friday Khutba?

hadith-eng:
A man entered the Mosque while the Prophet (ﷺ) was delivering the Khutba. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to him, 
"Have you prayed?" The man replied in the negative. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Pray two rak`at."
question: What is the significance of performing two rak'ahs upon entering the mosque during a sermon?

hadith-eng:
While the Prophet (ﷺ) was delivering the Khutba on a Friday, a man stood up and said, "O, Allah's 
Apostle! The livestock and the sheep are dying, so pray to Allah for rain." So he (the Prophet) raised 
both his hands and invoked Allah (for it).
question: What is the significance of making supplications during the Friday sermon?

hadith-eng:
Once in the lifetime of the Prophet (p.b.u.h) the people were afflicted with drought (famine). While 
the Prophet (ﷺ) was delivering the Khutba on a Friday, a Bedouin stood up and said, "O, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! 
Our possessions are being destroyed and the children are hungry; Please invoke Allah (for rain)". So 
the Prophet (ﷺ) raised his hands. At that time there was not a trace of cloud in the sky. By Him in Whose 
Hands my soul is as soon as he lowered his hands, clouds gathered like mountains, and before he got 
down from the pulpit, I saw the rain falling on the beard of the Prophet. It rained that day, the next 
day, the third day, the fourth day till the next Friday. The same Bedouin or another man stood up and 
said, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! The houses have collapsed, our possessions and livestock have been 
drowned; Please invoke Allah (to protect us)". So the Prophet (ﷺ) raised both his hands and said, "O 
Allah! Round about us and not on us". So, in whatever direction he pointed with his hands, the clouds 
dispersed and cleared away, and Medina's (sky) became clear as a hole in between the clouds. The 
valley of Qanat remained flooded, for one month, none came from outside but talked about the 
abundant rain.
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) respond to the request for rain during a drought?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) said, "When the Imam is delivering the Khutba, and you ask your companion 
to keep quiet and listen, then no doubt you have done an evil act."
question: What is the significance of remaining silent during the Imam's Khutba in Islam?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) talked about Friday and said, "There is an hour (opportune time) on Friday 
and if a Muslim gets it while praying and asks something from Allah, then Allah will definitely meet 
his demand." And he (the Prophet) pointed out the shortness of that time with his hands.
question: What is the significance of a specific hour on Friday in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
While we were praying (Jumua Khutba & prayer) with the Prophet (p.b.u.h), some camels loaded with 
food, arrived (from Sham). The people diverted their attention towards the camels (and left the 
mosque), and only twelve persons remained with the Prophet. So this verse was revealed: "But when 
they see Some bargain or some amusement, They disperse headlong to it, And leave you standing." 
(62.11)
question: What lesson can be learned about the importance of staying focused during prayer from this event?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to pray two rak`at before the Zuhr prayer and two rak`at after it. He also used to 
pray two rak`at after the Maghrib prayer in his house, and two rak`at after the `Isha' prayer. He never 
prayed after Jumua prayer till he departed (from the Mosque), and then he would pray two rak`at at 
home.
question: What is the significance of performing additional rak`at prayers before and after obligatory prayers?

hadith-eng:
There was a woman amongst us who had a farm and she used to sow Silq (a kind of vegetable) on the 
edges of streams in her farm. On Fridays she used to pull out the Silq from its roots and put the roots 
in a utensil. Then she would put a handful of powdered barley over it and cook it. The roots of the Silq 
were a substitute for meat. After finishing the Jumua prayer we used to greet her and she would give 
us that food which we would eat with our hands, and because of that meal, we used to look forward to 
Friday.
question: What significance does communal sharing of food have in fostering community bonds in Islam?

hadith-eng:
As above with the addition: We never had an afternoon nap nor meals except after offering the Jumua 
prayer.
question: What practices were followed by the companions of the Prophet regarding meals and rest on Fridays?

hadith-eng: We used to offer the Jumua prayer early and then have the afternoon nap.
question: What is the significance of offering the Jumua prayer early in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: We used to offer the Jumua prayer with the Prophet (ﷺ) and then take the afternoon nap.
question: What activities did the companions of the Prophet (ﷺ) engage in after the Jumua prayer?

hadith-eng:
I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) saying, "We (Muslims) are the last (to come) but (will be) the 
foremost on the Day of Resurrection though the former nations were given the Holy Scriptures before 
us. And this was their day (Friday) the celebration of which was made compulsory for them but they 
differed about it. So Allah gave us the guidance for it (Friday) and all the other people are behind us in 
this respect: the Jews' (holy day is) tomorrow (i.e. Saturday) and the Christians' (is) the day after 
tomorrow (i.e. Sunday)."
question: How did the guidance for the observance of Friday as a holy day come to the Muslim community?

hadith-eng: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) said, "Anyone of you attending the Friday (prayers) should take a bath."
question: How does personal hygiene relate to the practice of attending congregational prayers?

hadith-eng:
While `Umar bin Al-Khattab was standing and delivering the sermon on a Friday, one of the 
companions of the Prophet, who was one of the foremost Muhajirs (emigrants) came. `Umar said to 
him, "What is the time now?" He replied, "I was busy and could not go back to my house till I heard 
the Adhan. I did not perform more than the ablution." Thereupon `Umar said to him, "Did you 
perform only the ablution although you know that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) used to order us to take a 
bath (on Fridays)?"
question: How did the companions of the Prophet prioritize their religious duties during the time of the Adhan?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) said, "The taking of a bath on Friday is compulsory for every male (Muslim) 
who has attained the age of puberty."
question: At what age does the obligation of taking a bath on Friday become compulsory for Muslim males?

hadith-eng:
I testify that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "The taking of a bath on Friday is compulsory for every male 
Muslim who has attained the age of puberty and (also) the cleaning of his teeth with Siwak, and the 
using of perfume if it is available." `Amr (a sub-narrator) said, "I confirm that the taking of a bath is 
compulsory, but as for the Siwak and the using of perfume, Allah knows better whether it is 
obligatory or not, but according to the Hadith it is as above.")
question: Why is taking a bath on Friday considered compulsory for male Muslims who have reached puberty?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) said, "Any person who takes a bath on Friday like the bath of Janaba and 
then goes for the prayer (in the first hour i.e. early), it is as if he had sacrificed a camel (in Allah's 
cause); and whoever goes in the second hour it is as if he had sacrificed a cow; and whoever goes in 
the third hour, then it is as if he had sacrificed a horned ram; and if one goes in the fourth hour, then it 
is as if he had sacrificed a hen; and whoever goes in the fifth hour then it is as if he had offered an 
egg. When the Imam comes out (i.e. starts delivering the Khutba), the angels present themselves to 
listen to the Khutba."
question: How does the timing of attending Friday prayer relate to the rewards one receives?

hadith-eng:
While `Umar (bin Al-Khattab) was delivering the Khutba on a Friday, a man entered (the mosque). 
`Umar asked him, "What has detained you from the prayer?" The man said, "It was only that when I 
heard the Adhan I performed ablution (for the prayer)." On that `Umar said, "Did you not hear the 
Prophet saying: 'Anyone of you going out for the Jumua prayer should take a bath'?".
question: How does performing ablution relate to the preparation for Jumua prayer?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (p.b.u.h) said, "Whoever takes a bath on Friday, purifies himself as much as he can, then 
uses his (hair) oil or perfumes himself with the scent of his house, then proceeds (for the Jumua 
prayer) and does not separate two persons sitting together (in the mosque), then prays as much as 
(Allah has) written for him and then remains silent while the Imam is delivering the Khutba, his sins 
in-between the present and the last Friday would be forgiven."
question: How does attending the Friday prayer contribute to the forgiveness of sins?

hadith-eng:
I said to Ibn `Abbas, "The people are narrating that the Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Take a bath on Friday and wash 
your heads (i.e. take a thorough bath) even though you were not Junub and use perfume'." On that Ibn 
`Abbas replied, "I know about the bath, (i.e. it is essential) but I do not know about the perfume (i.e. 
whether it is essential or not.)
question: How does the use of perfume relate to the practices recommended for Friday?

hadith-eng:
Ibn `Abbas mentioned the statement of the Prophet (ﷺ) regarding the taking of a bath on Friday and then I 
asked him whether the Prophet (p.b.u.h) had ordered perfume or (hair) oil to be used if they could be 
found in one's house. He (Ibn `Abbas) replied that he did not know about it.
question: Is there any guidance on using perfume or hair oil on Fridays in Islam?

hadith-eng:
`Umar bin Al-Khattab saw a silken cloak (being sold) at the gate of the Mosque and said to Allah's 
Apostle, "I wish you would buy this to wear on Fridays and also on occasions of the arrivals of the 
delegations." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) replied, "This will be worn by a person who will have no share (reward) 
in the Hereafter." Later on similar cloaks were given to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and he gave one of them to 
`Umar bin Al-Khattab. On that `Umar said, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! You have given me this cloak 
although on the cloak of Atarid (a cloak merchant who was selling that silken cloak at the gate of the 
mosque) you passed such and such a remark." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) replied, "I have not given you this to 
wear". And so `Umar bin Al-Khattab gave it to his pagan brother in Mecca to wear.
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) respond to the suggestion of wearing luxurious clothing for special occasions?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "If I had not found it hard for my followers or the people, I would have ordered 
them to clean their teeth with Siwak for every prayer."
question: Why might the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) have refrained from making the use of Siwak obligatory for every prayer?

hadith-eng: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "I have told you repeatedly to use the Siwak. (The Prophet (ﷺ) put emphasis on the use of the Siwak.)
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) emphasize the importance of oral hygiene?

hadith-eng: When the Prophet (p.b.u.h) got up at night (for the night prayer), he used to clean his mouth .
question: How did the Prophet (p.b.u.h) maintain oral hygiene during his nightly routine?

hadith-eng:
`Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Bakr came holding a Siwak with which he was cleaning his teeth. Allah's 
Apostle looked at him. I requested `Abdur-Rahman to give the Siwak to me and after he gave it to me 
I divided it, chewed it and gave it to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). Then he cleaned his teeth with it and (at that 
time) he was resting against my chest.
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) maintain oral hygiene according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) used to recite the following in the Fajr prayer of Friday, "Alif, Lam, Mim, Tanzil" (Suratas- 
Sajda #32) and "Hal-ata-ala-l-Insani" (i.e. Surah-Ad-Dahr #76).
question: What is the significance of reciting specific Surahs during the Friday Fajr prayer?

hadith-eng:
The first Jumua prayer which was offered after a Jumua prayer offered at the mosque of Allah's 
Apostle took place in the mosque of the tribe of `Abdul Qais at Jawathi in Bahrain.
question: Which tribe's mosque hosted the first Jumua prayer after the Prophet's mosque?

hadith-eng:
I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saying, "All of you are Guardians." Yunis said: Ruzaiq bin Hukaim wrote to 
Ibn Shihab while I was with him at Wadi-al-Qura saying, "Shall I lead the Jumua prayer?" Ruzaiq was 
working on the land (i.e. farming) and there was a group of Sudanese people and some others with 
him; Ruzaiq was then the Governor of Aila. Ibn Shihab wrote (to Ruzaiq) ordering him to lead the 
Jumua prayer and telling him that Salim told him that `Abdullah bin `Umar had said, "I heard Allah's 
Apostle saying, 'All of you are guardians and responsible for your wards and the things under your 
care. The Imam (i.e. ruler) is the guardian of his subjects and is responsible for them and a man is the 
guardian of his family and is responsible for them. A woman is the guardian of her husband's house 
and is responsible for it. A servant is the guardian of his master's belongings and is responsible for 
them.' I thought that he also said, 'A man is the guardian of his father's property and is responsible for 
it. All of you are guardians and responsible for your wards and the things under your care."
question: How does Islam define the role of a ruler or leader in relation to their subjects?

hadith-eng: I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saying, "Anyone of you coming for the Jumua prayer should take a bath."
question: How does personal hygiene relate to the practice of attending congregational prayers in Islam?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "The taking of a bath on Friday is compulsory for every Muslim who has 
attained the age of puberty."
question: Why is personal hygiene emphasized in Islam, particularly on Fridays?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said "We are the last (to come amongst the nations) 
     but (will be) the foremost on the Day of Resurrection. They were given
     the Holy Scripture before us and we were given the Quran after them. 
     And this was the day (Friday) about which they differed and Allah gave
     us the guidance (for that). So tomorrow (i.e. Saturday) is the Jews' 
     (day), and the day after tomorrow (i.e. Sunday) is the Christians'." 
     The Prophet (p.b.u.h) remained silent (for a while) and then said, "It
     is obligatory for every Muslim that he should take a bath once in 
     seven days, when he should wash his head and body."
question: Why is it important for Muslims to perform a ritual bath once a week?

hadith-eng:
Narrated Abu Huraira through different narrators that the Prophet (ﷺ) 
     said, "It is Allah's right on every Muslim that he should take a bath 
     (at least) once in seven days."
question: How often is a Muslim encouraged to take a bath according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (p.b.u.h) said, "Allow women to go to the Mosques at night."
question: How does Islam address the participation of women in communal prayers?

hadith-eng:
One of the wives of `Umar (bin Al-Khattab) used to offer the Fajr and the `Isha' prayer in 
congregation in the Mosque. She was asked why she had come out for the prayer as she knew that 
`Umar disliked it, and he has great ghaira (self-respect). She replied, "What prevents him from 
stopping me from this act?" The other replied, "The statement of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) : 'Do not 
stop Allah's women-slaves from going to Allah's Mosques' prevents him."
question: How does the concept of ghaira (self-respect) relate to the practices of women attending congregational prayers?

hadith-eng:
On a rainy day Ibn `Abbas said to his Mu'adh-dhin, "After saying, 'Ash-hadu anna Muhammadan 
Rasulullah' (I testify that Muhammad is Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)), do not say 'Haiya 'Alas-Salat' (come for the 
prayer) but say 'Pray in your houses'." (The man did so). But the people disliked it. Ibn `Abbas said, 
"It was done by one who was much better than I (i.e. the Prophet (p.b.u.h) ). No doubt, the Jumua 
prayer is compulsory but I dislike to put you to task by bringing you out walking in mud and slush."
question: How does Islamic teaching prioritize the well-being of individuals in the context of communal religious obligations?

hadith-eng:
(the wife of the Prophet) The people used to come from their abodes and from Al-`Awali (i.e. 
outskirts of Medina up to a distance of four miles or more from Medina). They used to pass through 
dust and used to be drenched with sweat and covered with dust; so sweat used to trickle from them. 
One of them came to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) who was in my house. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to him, "I wish that you 
keep yourself clean on this day of yours (i.e. take a bath)."
question: How did the early Muslims maintain personal hygiene despite challenging conditions?

hadith-eng:
I asked `Amra about taking a bath on Fridays. She replied, " Aisha said, 'The people used to work (for 
their livelihood) and whenever they went for the Jumua prayer, they used to go to the mosque in the 
same shape as they had been in work. So they were asked to take a bath on Friday.' "
question: How did the early Muslims prepare themselves physically for the Friday prayer?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to offer the Jumua prayer immediately after midday.
question: What is the significance of the timing of the Jumu'ah prayer in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: We used to offer the Jumua prayer early and then have an afternoon nap.
question: How is the practice of taking an afternoon nap viewed in the context of Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) used to offer the prayer earlier if it was very cold; and if it was very hot he used to delay 
the prayer, i.e. the Jumua prayer.
question: What considerations did the Prophet (ﷺ) take into account when scheduling the Jumua prayer?

hadith-eng:
I heard the Prophet (ﷺ) saying, "Anyone whose feet are covered with dust in Allah's cause, shall be saved 
by Allah from the Hell-Fire."
question: How does physical effort in the path of Allah relate to spiritual rewards in Islam?

hadith-eng:
heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)s (p.b.u.h) saying, "If the prayer is started do not run for it but just walk for it 
calmly and pray whatever you get, and complete whatever is missed. "
question: How should a person complete their prayer if they miss part of it in congregation?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (p.b.u.h) said, "Do not stand up (for prayer) unless you see me, and observe calmness and 
solemnity".
question: Why is it important to wait for the leader before starting the prayer?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) said, "Anyone who takes a bath on Friday and cleans himself as much as he 
can and puts oil (on his hair) or scents himself; and then proceeds for the prayer and does not force his 
way between two persons (assembled in the mosque for the Friday prayer), and prays as much as is 
written for him and remains quiet when the Imam delivers the Khutba, all his sins in between the 
present and the last Friday will be forgiven."
question: How does maintaining silence during the Imam's Khutba contribute to the forgiveness of sins?

hadith-eng:
I heard Nazi' saying, "Ibn `Umar, said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade that a man should make another man to 
get up to sit in his place' ". I said to Nafi`, 'Is it for Jumua prayer only?' He replied, "For Jumua prayer 
and any other (prayer)."
question: How does Islamic etiquette address the issue of displacing someone from their seat during prayers?

hadith-eng:
In the lifetime of the Prophet, Abu Bakr and `Umar, the Adhan for the Jumua prayer used to be 
pronounced when the Imam sat on the pulpit. But during the Caliphate of `Uthman when the Muslims 
increased in number, a third Adhan at Az-Zaura' was added. Abu `Abdullah said, "Az-Zaura' is a place 
in the market of Medina."
question: What changes did Caliph Uthman implement in the Adhan for Jumu'a prayer due to the increase in the Muslim population?

hadith-eng:
The person who increased the number of Adhans for the Jumua prayers to three was `Uthman bin 
`Affan and it was when the number of the (Muslim) people of Medina had increased. In the lifetime of 
the Prophet (ﷺ) there was only one Mu'adh-dhin and the Adhan used to be pronounced only after the 
Imam had taken his seat (i.e. on the pulpit).
question: What was the practice regarding the Adhan during the lifetime of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) for Jumua prayers?

hadith-eng:
I heard Muawiya bin Abi Sufyan (repeating the statements of the Adhan) while he was sitting on the 
pulpit. When the Mu'adh-dhin pronounced the Adhan saying, "Allahu-Akbar, Allahu Akbar", 
Muawiya said: "Allah Akbar, Allahu Akbar." And when the Mu'adh-dhin said, "Ash-hadu an la ilaha 
illal-lah (I testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah)", Muawiya said, "And (so do) I". 
When he said, "Ash-hadu anna Muhammadan Rasulullah" (I testify that Muhammad is Allah's 
Apostle), Muawiya said, "And (so do) I". When the Adhan was finished, Muawiya said, "O people, 
when the Mu'adh-dhin pronounced the Adhan I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) on this very pulpit saying what 
you have just heard me saying".
question: How did Muawiya bin Abi Sufyan demonstrate his adherence to the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) during the Adhan?

hadith-eng:
`Uthman bin `Affan introduced the second Adhan on Fridays when the number of the people in the 
mosque increased. Previously the Adhan on Fridays used to be pronounced only after the Imam had 
taken his seat (on the pulpit).
question: Why was a second Adhan introduced on Fridays during the time of Uthman bin Affan?

hadith-eng:
I heard As-Saib bin Yazid, saying, "In the lifetime of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), and Abu Bakr and `Umar, the 
Adhan for the Jumua prayer used to be pronounced after the Imam had taken his seat on the pulpit. 
But when the people increased in number during the caliphate of `Uthman, he introduced a third 
Adhan (on Friday for the Jumua prayer) and it was pronounced at Az-Zaura' and that new state of 
affairs remained so in the succeeding years.
question: What changes were made to the Adhan for Jumua prayer due to the increase in the number of people attending?

hadith-eng:
Some people went to Sahl bin Sa`d As-Sa`idi and told him that they had different opinions regarding 
the wood of the pulpit. They asked him about it and he said, "By Allah, I know of what wood the 
pulpit was made, and no doubt I saw it on the very first day when Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) took his seat on it. 
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) sent for such and such an Ansari woman (and Sahl mentioned her name) and said to 
her, 'Order your slave-carpenter to prepare for me some pieces of wood (i.e. pulpit) on which I may sit 
at the time of addressing the people.' So she ordered her slave-carpenter and he made it from the 
tamarisk of the forest and brought it (to the woman). The woman sent that (pulpit) to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) 
who ordered it to be placed here. Then I saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) praying on it and then bowed on it. Then 
he stepped back, got down and prostrated on the ground near the foot of the pulpit and again ascended 
the pulpit. After finishing the prayer he faced the people and said, 'I have done this so that you may 
follow me and learn the way I pray.' "
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) use the pulpit during his prayers and what was the purpose of his actions?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) used to stand by a stem of a date-palm tree (while delivering a sermon). When the pulpit 
was placed for him we heard that stem crying like a pregnant she-camel till the Prophet (ﷺ) got down from 
the pulpit and placed his hand over it.
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) respond to the crying of the date-palm stem during his sermon?

hadith-eng:
My father said , "I heard the Prophet (ﷺ) delivering the Khutba on the pulpit and he said, 'Whoever comes 
for the Jumua prayer should take a bath (before coming).' "
question: How does cleanliness relate to the preparation for Jumua prayer in Islam?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (p.b.u.h) used to deliver the Khutba while standing and then he would sit, then stand 
again as you do now-a-days.
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (p.b.u.h) conduct the Khutba in terms of posture?

hadith-eng: One day the Prophet (ﷺ) sat on the pulpit and we sat around him.
question: How did the companions of the Prophet interact with him during his teachings?

hadith-eng: Asma' bint Abi Bakr As-Siddiq said, "I went to 'Aishah and the people were offering Salat. I asked her, 'What is wrong with the people ?' She pointed towards the sky with her head. I asked her, 'Is there a sign ?' 'Aishah nodded with her head meaning 'Yes'." Asma' added, "Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) prolonged the Salat to such an extent that I fainted. There was a waterskin by my side and I opened it and poured some water on my head. When Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) finished Salat, and the solar eclipse had cleared, the Prophet (ﷺ) addressed the people and praised Allah as He deserves and said, 'Amma ba'du'." Asma' further said, "Some Ansari women started talking, so I turned to them in order to make them quiet. I asked 'Aishah what the Prophet (ﷺ) had said. 'Aishah said: 'He said, 'I have seen things at this place of mine which were never shown to me before; (I have seen) even Paradise and Hell. And, no doubt it has been revealed to me that you (people) will be put in trial in your graves like or nearly like the trial of Masih Ad-Dajjal. (The angels) will come to everyone of you and ask him, 'What do you know about this man (Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)) ?" The faithful believer or firm believer (Hisham was in doubt which word the Prophet (ﷺ) used), will say, 'He is Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and he is Muhammad (ﷺ) who came to us with clear evidences and guidance. So we believed him, accepted his teachings and followed and trusted his teaching.' Then the angels will tell him to sleep (in peace) as they have come to know that he was a believer. But the hypocrite or a doubtful person (Hisham is not sure as to which word the Prophet (ﷺ) used), will be asked what he knew about this man (Prophet Muhammed (ﷺ)). He will say, 'I do not know but I heard the people saying something (about him) so I said the same' " Hisham added, "Fatima told me that she remembered that narration completely by heart except that she said about the hypocrite or a doubtful person that he will be punished severely."
question: How does the hadith describe the trial in the grave and the questions asked by the angels?

hadith-eng:
Some property or something was brought to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and he distributed it. He gave to some 
men and ignored the others. Later he got the news of his being admonished by those whom he had 
ignored. So he glorified and praised Allah and said, "Amma ba'du. By Allah, I may give to a man and 
ignore another, although the one whom I ignore is more beloved to me than the one whom I give. But 
I give to some people as I feel that they have no patience and no contentment in their hearts and I 
leave those who are patient and self-content with the goodness and wealth which Allah has put into 
their hearts and `Amr bin Taghlib is one of them." `Amr added, By Allah! Those words of Allah's 
Apostle are more beloved to me than the best red camels.
question: How does patience and contentment in one's heart affect their reception of wealth according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
Once in the middle of the night Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) went out and prayed in the mosque and some 
men prayed with him. The next morning the people spoke about it and so more people gathered and 
prayed with him (in the second night). They circulated the news in the morning, and so, on the third 
night the number of people increased greatly. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) came out and they prayed 
behind him. On the fourth night the mosque was overwhelmed by the people till it could not 
accommodate them. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) came out only for the Fajr prayer and when he finished the 
prayer, he faced the people and recited "Tashah-hud" (I testify that none has the right to be 
worshipped but Allah and that Muhammad is His Apostle), and then said, "Amma ba'du. Verily your 
presence (in the mosque at night) was not hidden from me, but I was afraid that this prayer (Prayer of 
Tahajjud) might be made compulsory and you might not be able to carry it out."
question: Why did the Prophet express concern about the night prayer becoming obligatory for the people?

hadith-eng:
One night Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) stood up after the prayer and recited "Tashah-hud" and then 
praised Allah as He deserved and said, "Amma ba'du."
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) praise Allah after completing his prayer?

hadith-eng:
Once Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) got up for delivering the Khutba and I heard him after "Tashah-hud" saying 
"Amma ba'du."
question: How does the structure of a Khutba typically begin after the Tashah-hud?

hadith-eng:
Once the Prophet (ﷺ) ascended the pulpit and it was the last gathering in which he took part. He was 
covering his shoulder with a big cloak and binding his head with an oily bandage. He glorified and 
praised Allah and said, "O people! Come to me." So the people came and gathered around him and he 
then said, "Amma ba'du." "From now onward the Ansar will decrease and other people will increase. 
So anybody who becomes a ruler of the followers of Muhammad and has the power to harm or benefit 
people then he should accept the good from the benevolent amongst them (Ansar) and overlook the 
faults of their wrong-doers."
question: What significance does the Prophet's (ﷺ) last gathering hold in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to deliver two Khutbas and sit in between them.
question: What is the purpose of sitting between the two Khutbas in a religious context?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "When it is a Friday, the angels stand at the gate of the mosque and keep on writing 
the names of the persons coming to the mosque in succession according to their arrivals. The example 
of the one who enters the mosque in the earliest hour is that of one offering a camel (in sacrifice). The 
one coming next is like one offering a cow and then a ram and then a chicken and then an egg 
respectively. When the Imam comes out (for Jumua prayer) they (i.e. angels) fold their papers and 
listen to the Khutba."
question: How do angels participate in the Friday prayer according to Islamic beliefs?

hadith-eng:
A person entered the mosque while the Prophet (ﷺ) was delivering the Khutba on a Friday. The Prophet (ﷺ) 
said to him, "Have you prayed?" The man replied in the negative. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Get up and pray 
two rak`at."
question: How should one respond if they have not prayed upon entering the mosque while a sermon is being delivered?

hadith-eng:
A man entered the Mosque while the Prophet (ﷺ) was delivering the Khutba. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to him, 
"Have you prayed?" The man replied in the negative. The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Pray two rak`at."
question: How does the Prophet (ﷺ) emphasize the importance of prayer even during the Friday sermon?

hadith-eng:
While the Prophet (ﷺ) was delivering the Khutba on a Friday, a man stood up and said, "O, Allah's 
Apostle! The livestock and the sheep are dying, so pray to Allah for rain." So he (the Prophet) raised 
both his hands and invoked Allah (for it).
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) respond to requests for rain during times of drought?

hadith-eng:
Once in the lifetime of the Prophet (p.b.u.h) the people were afflicted with drought (famine). While 
the Prophet (ﷺ) was delivering the Khutba on a Friday, a Bedouin stood up and said, "O, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! 
Our possessions are being destroyed and the children are hungry; Please invoke Allah (for rain)". So 
the Prophet (ﷺ) raised his hands. At that time there was not a trace of cloud in the sky. By Him in Whose 
Hands my soul is as soon as he lowered his hands, clouds gathered like mountains, and before he got 
down from the pulpit, I saw the rain falling on the beard of the Prophet. It rained that day, the next 
day, the third day, the fourth day till the next Friday. The same Bedouin or another man stood up and 
said, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! The houses have collapsed, our possessions and livestock have been 
drowned; Please invoke Allah (to protect us)". So the Prophet (ﷺ) raised both his hands and said, "O 
Allah! Round about us and not on us". So, in whatever direction he pointed with his hands, the clouds 
dispersed and cleared away, and Medina's (sky) became clear as a hole in between the clouds. The 
valley of Qanat remained flooded, for one month, none came from outside but talked about the 
abundant rain.
question: What was the reaction of the people when the Prophet's supplication for rain was answered?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) said, "When the Imam is delivering the Khutba, and you ask your companion 
to keep quiet and listen, then no doubt you have done an evil act."
question: Why is it considered an evil act to speak during the Friday sermon?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) talked about Friday and said, "There is an hour (opportune time) on Friday 
and if a Muslim gets it while praying and asks something from Allah, then Allah will definitely meet 
his demand." And he (the Prophet) pointed out the shortness of that time with his hands.
question: How does prayer play a role in having one's requests fulfilled by Allah on Fridays?

hadith-eng:
While we were praying (Jumua Khutba & prayer) with the Prophet (p.b.u.h), some camels loaded with 
food, arrived (from Sham). The people diverted their attention towards the camels (and left the 
mosque), and only twelve persons remained with the Prophet. So this verse was revealed: "But when 
they see Some bargain or some amusement, They disperse headlong to it, And leave you standing." 
(62.11)
question: How does the incident of people leaving the mosque during prayer relate to the teachings of the Quran?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) used to pray two rak`at before the Zuhr prayer and two rak`at after it. He also used to 
pray two rak`at after the Maghrib prayer in his house, and two rak`at after the `Isha' prayer. He never 
prayed after Jumua prayer till he departed (from the Mosque), and then he would pray two rak`at at 
home.
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) incorporate voluntary prayers into his daily routine?

hadith-eng:
There was a woman amongst us who had a farm and she used to sow Silq (a kind of vegetable) on the 
edges of streams in her farm. On Fridays she used to pull out the Silq from its roots and put the roots 
in a utensil. Then she would put a handful of powdered barley over it and cook it. The roots of the Silq 
were a substitute for meat. After finishing the Jumua prayer we used to greet her and she would give 
us that food which we would eat with our hands, and because of that meal, we used to look forward to 
Friday.
question: How can simple acts of kindness, like sharing a meal, impact the anticipation and experience of religious gatherings?

hadith-eng:
As above with the addition: We never had an afternoon nap nor meals except after offering the Jumua 
prayer.
question: How did the companions prioritize their activities around the Jumua prayer?

hadith-eng: We used to offer the Jumua prayer early and then have the afternoon nap.
question: How was the practice of taking an afternoon nap viewed in the context of early Islamic practices?

hadith-eng: We used to offer the Jumua prayer with the Prophet (ﷺ) and then take the afternoon nap.
question: How was the practice of taking an afternoon nap viewed in the context of early Islamic traditions?

hadith-eng:
I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) saying, "We (Muslims) are the last (to come) but (will be) the 
foremost on the Day of Resurrection though the former nations were given the Holy Scriptures before 
us. And this was their day (Friday) the celebration of which was made compulsory for them but they 
differed about it. So Allah gave us the guidance for it (Friday) and all the other people are behind us in 
this respect: the Jews' (holy day is) tomorrow (i.e. Saturday) and the Christians' (is) the day after 
tomorrow (i.e. Sunday)."
question: In what way are Muslims considered foremost on the Day of Resurrection according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) said, "Anyone of you attending the Friday (prayers) should take a bath."
question: What are the recommended practices for Muslims to prepare for Friday prayers?

hadith-eng:
While `Umar bin Al-Khattab was standing and delivering the sermon on a Friday, one of the 
companions of the Prophet, who was one of the foremost Muhajirs (emigrants) came. `Umar said to 
him, "What is the time now?" He replied, "I was busy and could not go back to my house till I heard 
the Adhan. I did not perform more than the ablution." Thereupon `Umar said to him, "Did you 
perform only the ablution although you know that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) used to order us to take a 
bath (on Fridays)?"
question: What can be inferred about the importance of cleanliness and preparation for Friday prayers from this incident?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) said, "The taking of a bath on Friday is compulsory for every male (Muslim) 
who has attained the age of puberty."
question: Why is personal hygiene emphasized in Islam, particularly on Fridays?

hadith-eng:
I testify that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "The taking of a bath on Friday is compulsory for every male 
Muslim who has attained the age of puberty and (also) the cleaning of his teeth with Siwak, and the 
using of perfume if it is available." `Amr (a sub-narrator) said, "I confirm that the taking of a bath is 
compulsory, but as for the Siwak and the using of perfume, Allah knows better whether it is 
obligatory or not, but according to the Hadith it is as above.")
question: What is the significance of using Siwak and perfume on Fridays in Islam?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) said, "Any person who takes a bath on Friday like the bath of Janaba and 
then goes for the prayer (in the first hour i.e. early), it is as if he had sacrificed a camel (in Allah's 
cause); and whoever goes in the second hour it is as if he had sacrificed a cow; and whoever goes in 
the third hour, then it is as if he had sacrificed a horned ram; and if one goes in the fourth hour, then it 
is as if he had sacrificed a hen; and whoever goes in the fifth hour then it is as if he had offered an 
egg. When the Imam comes out (i.e. starts delivering the Khutba), the angels present themselves to 
listen to the Khutba."
question: What is the role of angels during the Friday Khutba according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
While `Umar (bin Al-Khattab) was delivering the Khutba on a Friday, a man entered (the mosque). 
`Umar asked him, "What has detained you from the prayer?" The man said, "It was only that when I 
heard the Adhan I performed ablution (for the prayer)." On that `Umar said, "Did you not hear the 
Prophet saying: 'Anyone of you going out for the Jumua prayer should take a bath'?".
question: What can be inferred about the importance of punctuality for Jumua prayer from this incident?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (p.b.u.h) said, "Whoever takes a bath on Friday, purifies himself as much as he can, then 
uses his (hair) oil or perfumes himself with the scent of his house, then proceeds (for the Jumua 
prayer) and does not separate two persons sitting together (in the mosque), then prays as much as 
(Allah has) written for him and then remains silent while the Imam is delivering the Khutba, his sins 
in-between the present and the last Friday would be forgiven."
question: What is the significance of remaining silent during the Imam's Khutba in the mosque?

hadith-eng:
I said to Ibn `Abbas, "The people are narrating that the Prophet (ﷺ) said, 'Take a bath on Friday and wash 
your heads (i.e. take a thorough bath) even though you were not Junub and use perfume'." On that Ibn 
`Abbas replied, "I know about the bath, (i.e. it is essential) but I do not know about the perfume (i.e. 
whether it is essential or not.)
question: What are the differing opinions on the necessity of using perfume on Fridays?

hadith-eng:
Ibn `Abbas mentioned the statement of the Prophet (ﷺ) regarding the taking of a bath on Friday and then I 
asked him whether the Prophet (p.b.u.h) had ordered perfume or (hair) oil to be used if they could be 
found in one's house. He (Ibn `Abbas) replied that he did not know about it.
question: How does the practice of taking a bath on Friday relate to cleanliness and preparation for communal prayers?

hadith-eng:
`Umar bin Al-Khattab saw a silken cloak (being sold) at the gate of the Mosque and said to Allah's 
Apostle, "I wish you would buy this to wear on Fridays and also on occasions of the arrivals of the 
delegations." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) replied, "This will be worn by a person who will have no share (reward) 
in the Hereafter." Later on similar cloaks were given to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and he gave one of them to 
`Umar bin Al-Khattab. On that `Umar said, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! You have given me this cloak 
although on the cloak of Atarid (a cloak merchant who was selling that silken cloak at the gate of the 
mosque) you passed such and such a remark." Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) replied, "I have not given you this to 
wear". And so `Umar bin Al-Khattab gave it to his pagan brother in Mecca to wear.
question: What lesson can be learned from Umar bin Al-Khattab's action of giving the cloak to his pagan brother?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "If I had not found it hard for my followers or the people, I would have ordered 
them to clean their teeth with Siwak for every prayer."
question: How does cleanliness relate to the performance of prayer in Islam?

hadith-eng: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "I have told you repeatedly to use the Siwak. (The Prophet (ﷺ) put emphasis on the use of the Siwak.)
question: What are the benefits of following the Prophet's guidance on personal cleanliness?

hadith-eng: When the Prophet (p.b.u.h) got up at night (for the night prayer), he used to clean his mouth .
question: What is the significance of cleanliness in the context of Islamic prayers?

hadith-eng:
`Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Bakr came holding a Siwak with which he was cleaning his teeth. Allah's 
Apostle looked at him. I requested `Abdur-Rahman to give the Siwak to me and after he gave it to me 
I divided it, chewed it and gave it to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). Then he cleaned his teeth with it and (at that 
time) he was resting against my chest.
question: What role did Aisha play in assisting the Prophet (ﷺ) with personal care?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) used to recite the following in the Fajr prayer of Friday, "Alif, Lam, Mim, Tanzil" (Suratas- 
Sajda #32) and "Hal-ata-ala-l-Insani" (i.e. Surah-Ad-Dahr #76).
question: How does the practice of reciting certain Surahs in prayer reflect the traditions of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng:
The first Jumua prayer which was offered after a Jumua prayer offered at the mosque of Allah's 
Apostle took place in the mosque of the tribe of `Abdul Qais at Jawathi in Bahrain.
question: What is the significance of the mosque of the tribe of `Abdul Qais in Islamic history?

hadith-eng:
I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saying, "All of you are Guardians." Yunis said: Ruzaiq bin Hukaim wrote to 
Ibn Shihab while I was with him at Wadi-al-Qura saying, "Shall I lead the Jumua prayer?" Ruzaiq was 
working on the land (i.e. farming) and there was a group of Sudanese people and some others with 
him; Ruzaiq was then the Governor of Aila. Ibn Shihab wrote (to Ruzaiq) ordering him to lead the 
Jumua prayer and telling him that Salim told him that `Abdullah bin `Umar had said, "I heard Allah's 
Apostle saying, 'All of you are guardians and responsible for your wards and the things under your 
care. The Imam (i.e. ruler) is the guardian of his subjects and is responsible for them and a man is the 
guardian of his family and is responsible for them. A woman is the guardian of her husband's house 
and is responsible for it. A servant is the guardian of his master's belongings and is responsible for 
them.' I thought that he also said, 'A man is the guardian of his father's property and is responsible for 
it. All of you are guardians and responsible for your wards and the things under your care."
question: What is the significance of guardianship and accountability in family and societal structures in Islam?

hadith-eng: I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) saying, "Anyone of you coming for the Jumua prayer should take a bath."
question: What are the recommended practices for Muslims to prepare for the Jumua prayer?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "The taking of a bath on Friday is compulsory for every Muslim who has 
attained the age of puberty."
question: At what age does the obligation of taking a bath on Friday become compulsory for Muslims?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said "We are the last (to come amongst the nations) 
     but (will be) the foremost on the Day of Resurrection. They were given
     the Holy Scripture before us and we were given the Quran after them. 
     And this was the day (Friday) about which they differed and Allah gave
     us the guidance (for that). So tomorrow (i.e. Saturday) is the Jews' 
     (day), and the day after tomorrow (i.e. Sunday) is the Christians'." 
     The Prophet (p.b.u.h) remained silent (for a while) and then said, "It
     is obligatory for every Muslim that he should take a bath once in 
     seven days, when he should wash his head and body."
question: How does the sequence of receiving holy scriptures relate to the position of Muslims on the Day of Resurrection?

hadith-eng:
Narrated Abu Huraira through different narrators that the Prophet (ﷺ) 
     said, "It is Allah's right on every Muslim that he should take a bath 
     (at least) once in seven days."
question: What are the rights of Allah upon Muslims concerning cleanliness?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (p.b.u.h) said, "Allow women to go to the Mosques at night."
question: What are the guidelines for women's attendance at mosques according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
One of the wives of `Umar (bin Al-Khattab) used to offer the Fajr and the `Isha' prayer in 
congregation in the Mosque. She was asked why she had come out for the prayer as she knew that 
`Umar disliked it, and he has great ghaira (self-respect). She replied, "What prevents him from 
stopping me from this act?" The other replied, "The statement of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) : 'Do not 
stop Allah's women-slaves from going to Allah's Mosques' prevents him."
question: What role does the Prophet Muhammad's guidance play in shaping the practices of women attending mosques for prayer?

hadith-eng:
On a rainy day Ibn `Abbas said to his Mu'adh-dhin, "After saying, 'Ash-hadu anna Muhammadan 
Rasulullah' (I testify that Muhammad is Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)), do not say 'Haiya 'Alas-Salat' (come for the 
prayer) but say 'Pray in your houses'." (The man did so). But the people disliked it. Ibn `Abbas said, 
"It was done by one who was much better than I (i.e. the Prophet (p.b.u.h) ). No doubt, the Jumua 
prayer is compulsory but I dislike to put you to task by bringing you out walking in mud and slush."
question: What is the significance of following the Prophet's example in making decisions related to religious practices?

hadith-eng:
(the wife of the Prophet) The people used to come from their abodes and from Al-`Awali (i.e. 
outskirts of Medina up to a distance of four miles or more from Medina). They used to pass through 
dust and used to be drenched with sweat and covered with dust; so sweat used to trickle from them. 
One of them came to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) who was in my house. The Prophet (ﷺ) said to him, "I wish that you 
keep yourself clean on this day of yours (i.e. take a bath)."
question: What advice did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) give regarding cleanliness to those visiting him?

hadith-eng:
I asked `Amra about taking a bath on Fridays. She replied, " Aisha said, 'The people used to work (for 
their livelihood) and whenever they went for the Jumua prayer, they used to go to the mosque in the 
same shape as they had been in work. So they were asked to take a bath on Friday.' "
question: What was the reason behind the recommendation for taking a bath on Fridays according to the practices of the early Muslims?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to offer the Jumua prayer immediately after midday.
question: How does the timing of the Jumu'ah prayer relate to the daily schedule of a Muslim?

hadith-eng: We used to offer the Jumua prayer early and then have an afternoon nap.
question: What are the benefits of combining religious practices with rest in Islam?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) used to offer the prayer earlier if it was very cold; and if it was very hot he used to delay 
the prayer, i.e. the Jumua prayer.
question: How does the timing of prayers reflect the flexibility in Islamic practices?

hadith-eng:
I heard the Prophet (ﷺ) saying, "Anyone whose feet are covered with dust in Allah's cause, shall be saved 
by Allah from the Hell-Fire."
question: What are the spiritual benefits of participating in activities for the sake of Allah?

hadith-eng:
heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)s (p.b.u.h) saying, "If the prayer is started do not run for it but just walk for it 
calmly and pray whatever you get, and complete whatever is missed. "
question: What is the significance of walking calmly to join a prayer that has already started?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (p.b.u.h) said, "Do not stand up (for prayer) unless you see me, and observe calmness and 
solemnity".
question: How does the presence of the Prophet influence the commencement of prayer?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) (p.b.u.h) said, "Anyone who takes a bath on Friday and cleans himself as much as he 
can and puts oil (on his hair) or scents himself; and then proceeds for the prayer and does not force his 
way between two persons (assembled in the mosque for the Friday prayer), and prays as much as is 
written for him and remains quiet when the Imam delivers the Khutba, all his sins in between the 
present and the last Friday will be forgiven."
question: What is the significance of personal grooming and etiquette in the context of Friday prayers?

hadith-eng:
I heard Nazi' saying, "Ibn `Umar, said, 'The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade that a man should make another man to 
get up to sit in his place' ". I said to Nafi`, 'Is it for Jumua prayer only?' He replied, "For Jumua prayer 
and any other (prayer)."
question: What are the guidelines for seating arrangements during Jumu'ah and other prayers in Islam?

hadith-eng:
In the lifetime of the Prophet, Abu Bakr and `Umar, the Adhan for the Jumua prayer used to be 
pronounced when the Imam sat on the pulpit. But during the Caliphate of `Uthman when the Muslims 
increased in number, a third Adhan at Az-Zaura' was added. Abu `Abdullah said, "Az-Zaura' is a place 
in the market of Medina."
question: What significance does the location Az-Zaura' hold in the context of the Adhan for Jumu'a prayer?

hadith-eng:
The person who increased the number of Adhans for the Jumua prayers to three was `Uthman bin 
`Affan and it was when the number of the (Muslim) people of Medina had increased. In the lifetime of 
the Prophet (ﷺ) there was only one Mu'adh-dhin and the Adhan used to be pronounced only after the 
Imam had taken his seat (i.e. on the pulpit).
question: Why was there a change in the number of Adhans for Jumua prayers during the time of Uthman bin Affan?

hadith-eng:
I heard Muawiya bin Abi Sufyan (repeating the statements of the Adhan) while he was sitting on the 
pulpit. When the Mu'adh-dhin pronounced the Adhan saying, "Allahu-Akbar, Allahu Akbar", 
Muawiya said: "Allah Akbar, Allahu Akbar." And when the Mu'adh-dhin said, "Ash-hadu an la ilaha 
illal-lah (I testify that none has the right to be worshipped but Allah)", Muawiya said, "And (so do) I". 
When he said, "Ash-hadu anna Muhammadan Rasulullah" (I testify that Muhammad is Allah's 
Apostle), Muawiya said, "And (so do) I". When the Adhan was finished, Muawiya said, "O people, 
when the Mu'adh-dhin pronounced the Adhan I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) on this very pulpit saying what 
you have just heard me saying".
question: What can be learned about the practice of responding to the Adhan from the actions of Muawiya bin Abi Sufyan?

hadith-eng:
`Uthman bin `Affan introduced the second Adhan on Fridays when the number of the people in the 
mosque increased. Previously the Adhan on Fridays used to be pronounced only after the Imam had 
taken his seat (on the pulpit).
question: How did the increase in the number of people attending the mosque affect the practice of Adhan on Fridays?

hadith-eng:
